programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: Seattle claimed a 79-71 victory against Dallas in their first meeting of the season on May 19, led by 23 points and 18 rebounds from Nneka Ogwumike; Paige Bueckers recorded 19 points and 8 assists for the Wings in the loss at home.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: The winner of each regional advances to play in a best-of-three super regional round, with the eight remaining teams advancing to College World Series; Vanderbilt, Texas, Arkansas, Auburn, UNC, LSU, Georgia and Oregon State are the top eight seeds.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: A rematch of the 2024 World Series, Los Angeles won its first title since 2020 after defeating New York, 4-1, behind MVP Freddie Freeman, who led the Dodgers with four home runs and 12 RBIs in the five games, and Teoscar Hernandez.

programme.title: UFC Countdown
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at fighter training camps as they prepare for their marquee matchups on pay-per-view or other televised events to show how they train for the fight, and interviews with the fighters give a look inside the fighter's mind.

programme.title: ACC Huddle Special: Dabo Swinney and Bill Belichick
Gr8tness
programme.desc: A record once thought to be untouchable, Alex Ovechkin gives an all-access look as he chases the 894 goals of the legendary Wayne Gretzky, showing how he prepares for his games and the pressure he is facing to break the prestigious record.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's College World Series
programme.desc: No. 2 seed Oklahoma, No. 3 seed Florida, No. 6 seed Texas, No. 7 seed Tennessee, No. 9 seed UCLA, No. 12 seed Texas Tech, No. 16 seed Oregon and Ole Miss compete in the double-elimination format; Oklahoma is the four-time defending champion.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Fernando Valenzuela set off a craze around the country, primarily in the Los Angeles area, after he was acquired by the Dodgers, and the 1981 season saw his relationship with the Latino community blossom and the establishment of "Fernandomania."

programme.desc: Rivalries come to be for various reasons, but a hit by Claude Lemieux of the Colorado Avalanche on Kris Draper of the Detroit Red Wings in the late 1990s would ignite a rivalry in the NHL that would stand the test of time between the two teams.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: The docuseries showcases some of the most exotic and hidden soccer fields from around the world, showcasing how the field provides the locals an opportunity to grow the sport and the unique sights and surroundings that make the field stand out.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: UFC Hall of Famers Daniel Cormier and Chael Sonnen select their eight-fighter teams of welterweights and flyweights from 10 different countries, as the action gets underway in the octagon between two of the recently-selected flyweights.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: UFC Hall of Famers Daniel Cormier and Chael Sonnen select their eight-fighter teams of welterweights and flyweights from 10 different countries, as the action gets underway in the octagon between two of the recently-selected flyweights.

programme.title: Major League Rugby
programme.desc: Coverage of the professional rugby league of the United States.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Two of the more prestigious names in the UFC coach their teams of up-and-coming fighters, who are in search of a UFC contract for winning the season, as they compete against each other in the Octagon and in challenges outside of the bouts.

programme.title: The Hoop Collective
programme.desc: Brian Windhorst and a group of ESPN insiders cover anything and everything from around the NBA, breaking down the latest stories making headlines, recapping and previewing marquee matchups, and interviewing guests to gather their thoughts.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis (7-2) won five-straight games after a 39-13 win over San Antonio behind Max Duggan and Brandon Silvers; DC (6-3) defeated the Battlehawks, 27-15, on April 13 behind 243 passing yards and three touchdowns from Jordan Ta'amu.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Vancouver progressed past Inter Miami with a 5-1 aggregate victory in the semi-finals round after a 3-1 win in the second leg on April 30; Cruz Azul claimed a 2-1 aggregate win against Tigres through a 1-0 shutout victory in the second leg on May 1.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending champion Birmingham (6-3) won three of its last four games after a 26-22 win over Michigan behind J'Mar Simth and Larry Rountree III; Memphis (2-7) defeated the Stallions, 24-20, on April 25 behind 235 passing yards from Dresser Winn.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou continued his dominant start with his first Indianapolis 500 win of his career to increase his lead over Pato O'Ward to 112 points; Scott Dixon won the race at Detroit last year over Marcus Ericsson.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Milwaukee won two of its three games at American Family Field earlier this season, winning the rubber game of the series, 8-2; Milwaukee won five of its seven games at Great American Ball Park last season, outscoring the Reds, 51-29.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Tony Stewart leads Shawn Langdon in Top Fuel by three points, Austin Prock leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by 51 points and Dallas Glenn leads Greg Anderson in Pro Stock by 11 points following Chicago, the sixth event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis (7-2) won five-straight games after a 39-13 win over San Antonio behind Max Duggan and Brandon Silvers; DC (6-3) defeated the Battlehawks, 27-15, on April 13 behind 243 passing yards and three touchdowns from Jordan Ta'amu.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Milwaukee won two of its three games at American Family Field earlier this season, winning the rubber game of the series, 8-2; Milwaukee won five of its seven games at Great American Ball Park last season, outscoring the Reds, 51-29.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou continued his dominant start with his first Indianapolis 500 win of his career to increase his lead over Pato O'Ward to 112 points; Scott Dixon won the race at Detroit last year over Marcus Ericsson.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending champion Birmingham (6-3) won three of its last four games after a 26-22 win over Michigan behind J'Mar Simth and Larry Rountree III; Memphis (2-7) defeated the Stallions, 24-20, on April 25 behind 235 passing yards from Dresser Winn.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Soccer
programme.desc: Germany claimed a 4-2 win over Portugal in their most recent meeting from the group stage of the 2021 Euro where Germany's Robin Gosens had a goal and an assist; Cristiano Ronaldo and Diogo Jota both had a goal and assist for Portugal in the defeat.

DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
Indycar INXT Racing
programme.desc: Rookie Lochie Hughes cut his deficit to fellow rookie Dennis Hauger to 15 points after finishing first and second in the two races at Indianapolis; Louis Foster won the race at Detroit last year over Caio Collet en route to the 2024 championship.

programme.desc: A thorough preview of the upcoming UEFA Nations League matchup, including in-depth analysis of strategy, key things to watch, exclusive interviews, predictions from experts, special features and a breakdown of each club's strengths and weaknesses.

programme.title: DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: 100 Days to Indy
programme.desc: Chip Ganassi Racing secures a win, with Marcus Ericsson taking the top spot at St. Petersburg; the infamous Andretti Autosport, with seven-time champion Colton Herta in the lead, aim to return to form; Arrow McLaren fight to overtake their rivals.

programme.title: DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Vancouver progressed past Inter Miami with a 5-1 aggregate victory in the semi-finals round after a 3-1 win in the second leg on April 30; Cruz Azul claimed a 2-1 aggregate win against Tigres through a 1-0 shutout victory in the second leg on May 1.

programme.title: DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
2025 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Championship
programme.desc: Mexico claimed a 2-1 victory against Canada in their last meeting from the semi-finals round of 2023's Championship with a stoppage-time winner from Alice Soto; Mailin Orozco had equalized for Mexico after goind down, 1-0, to a Kayla Briggs goal.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Corey Heim secured his fourth win of the season and second in the last four races with a dominant victory at Charlotte over Ross Chastain; Christian Eckes averaged 101.829 mph in his win at Nashville last year, beating Daniel Dye by 2.028 seconds.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Championship
programme.desc: Panama is coming off of a 4-0 defeat to Mexico in their second match of the group stage on May 31 where they conceded a brace to Deiry Ramirez; Nicaragua suffered a 4-1 defeat to Canada with their lone goal of the match scored by Jenifer Sarantes.

programme.title: DIRT II: A Season With High Limit

programme.desc: Gary Williams, the original host of Morning Drive on the Golf Channel, hosts the podcast that features interviews with golf's top personalities, provides golf equipment reviews in the Tool Box segment, golf travel destination tips and much more.

programme.title: 2025 U.S. Women's Open Golf Championship
programme.desc: Yuka Saso of Japan carded a 2-under 68 over the final round to finish atop the leaderboard at 4-under 276 and captured the title for the second time in four years with a three-stroke victory over Hinako Shibuno in last year's edition.

programme.title: PGA Tour Champions Golf
programme.desc: Ernie Els of South Africa carded a 7-under 65 over the final round to remain atop the leaderboard at 21-under 195 to secure a two-stroke wire-to-wire victory over Stephen Ames in last year's edition; Els captured his fourth PGA Tour Champions title.

programme.title: Golf Channel Podcast with Rex & Lav
programme.desc: The GolfChannel's Rex Hoggard and Ryan Lavner discuss and debate the latest news, players to watch and predict major winners across the PGA TOUR, DP World Tour, LPGA Tour, Korn Ferry Tour, Champions Tour, LIV Tour, College Golf and the amateur game.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: World No. 1 Scottie Scheffler took home a $4 million payday after carding a 2-over 74 over the final round to remain atop the leaderboard at 8-under 280 to hold off Collin Morikawa for a one-shot victory in last year's edition of the tournament.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: World No. 1 Scottie Scheffler took home a $4 million payday after carding a 2-over 74 over the final round to remain atop the leaderboard at 8-under 280 to hold off Collin Morikawa for a one-shot victory in last year's edition of the tournament.

programme.title: PGA Tour Champions Learning Center
programme.desc: All of the latest news, highlights and inside information from the Champions Tour is provided along with helpful instruction from the legendary players on the tour, who are some of the most experienced professionals in the game.

programme.title: School of Golf
programme.desc: Some of the best teenage golfers in the country spend time at the Hank Haney Golf Academy in order to take their game to the next level; the teenagers will get professional instruction while trying to manage their high school lives.
